comments.text:
Hello,

Firefox 5.0. Mac OS X 10.6.8.
I have a dialog in the background.
The Save button is disabled, for the sake of security I guess. Good idea.
I click in the dialog.
The Save button gets enabled only after a delay.
I put the dialog in the background.
The Save button is disabled.
I click on the Save button of the dialog.
It gets enabled only after a delay.
I put the dialog in the background.
Now, I click the Save button and I keep my mouse pressed. After a while, I drop my mouse.
Too bad ! The button has been pushed.
See and hear screen film :
http://screencast.com/t/Bh3cmrA7
This is incorrect.
When the user clicks on the disabled Save button, the click must not push the button.

Thanks for correcting that,

Nicolas

comments.text: Not a security bug per se since user's can't be fooled into holding their mouse down on the save button without knowing what it is. Does sound like a legitimate widget bug that we're only testing on mouse up or something (guessing) where we really shouldn't count the down-up as part of the same action if the disabled state changes in the middle.
